description.raw:
Make wait monitors optional.

It will be up to individual devices whether to raise an exception if they are
asked to do analog input and require a wait monitor when one is not present,
or if they require a wait monitor for any other purpose.

If using a wait monitor, make the use of a timeout device optional.

Add a detailed docstring for WaitMonitor.

This has been something requested for a while, and hacked into a few labscript installations around here already. Our labs have a 60hz trigger firing constantly, that is not expected to fail, is not unsafe if it does fail, and most of the time we are not doing AI on NI DAQmx devices. So the complexity of implementing a wait monitor has been a hindrance.

This PR allows you to just to wait() without creating a wait monitor. The pseudoclock will just wait until retriggered, and it's up to you to ensure it is triggered or to deal with the consequences.

A corresponding pull request to labscript_devices modifies the NI DAQmx driver to raise an exception if you try to use waits and AI at the same time without a wait monitor, since one is required in that case.
